column4: the hell?
there's no make file
ok...i'm TOTALLY lost
it looks like they have a binary driver, and instrutions for compilation
only a bunch of .ko files
what is this that you want to compile?
well, i'm trying to install drivers for a rt73 based wireless network card
Debian drivers should work. have you tried them?
they are kernel modules. i was under the impression they are supposed to be compliled against mt kernel?
you are correct
what kind of card is this? PCI? Cardbus?
USB
personally, with the hassle you will face, i'd get a supported adapter
*every* time Ubuntu updates your kernel you'll need to recompile the drivers.
i got it cause i thought it was supported
i'm fine with that, actually
does it need to be USB, or is PCI(Express) or Cardbus or PCMCIA OK?
k
the USB sticks will be tricky. they are made with lowest common denominator hardware, which usuallt means Broadcom.
ubuntu detects it as a ralink, and it has drivers for linux on the
it has drivers for linux on the disk. obviously compiled by someone clueless ;p
